thread.title: PSV keeper completely misses the point of goal-line technology after making a DREADFUL howler
thread.title_full: PSV keeper completely misses the point of goal-line technology after making a DREADFUL howler

author: Jon Moody
title: PSV keeper completely misses the point of goal-line technology after making a DREADFUL howler
text:
Get daily   Could   
"Bring in goal line technology!" they said. 
"It'll improve the game!" they said. "We'll finally be able to get rid of fundamental mistakes in the game!" they said. 
Well, we've got it now. And yes, while mistakes from officials is now a thing of the past, the introduction of technology to the game won't do anything to stop out-and-out howlers like this from happening. 
Enter PSV goalkeeper Jeroen Zoet. (Photo: Getty Images) 
In a title six-pointer against rivals Feyenoord , the Dutchman produced one of the all-time great own goal howlers - as you can see in the video at the top of the page. 
The keeper saved a header from Jan-Arie van der Heijden, fumbled it, then just about stopped it from going over the line. (Photo: @fcrotterdam / Twitter) 
As the moment died down, he proceeded to pick the ball up... while he was STILL behind the goal-line. "Buzz" went the ref's special watch and the goal was given - simultaneously ending PSV's title hopes. (Photo: @fcrotterdam / Twitter) 
No complaints from those who understand the rules of the game, but speaking after the match, Zoet seemed to completely miss the point of goal-line technology.
